definitions: small to medium-sized hound dog breed with drooping ears and tricolor coat
examples: The beagle sniffed around the garden looking for rabbits
Our neighbor's beagle barks whenever the mailman arrives

definitions: hard pointed or curved mouth structure of birds used for eating
examples: The eagle's sharp beak tore through the fish easily
The parrot cracked nuts with its powerful curved beak

definitions: cylindrical glass container with spout used in laboratories for measuring and pouring
examples: The scientist poured the solution into a glass beaker
She heated the liquid in a beaker over the Bunsen burner

definitions: small close-fitting knitted cap typically worn on top of the head
examples: He wore a wool beanie to keep his head warm
The colorful beanie matched her winter scarf perfectly

definitions: main stem of a bean plant that supports leaves and pods
examples: The beanstalk grew tall enough to reach the fence
Jack climbed the magical beanstalk in the fairy tale

definitions: hair growing on chin and cheeks of adult males
examples: He decided to grow a beard during the winter months
The barber carefully trimmed his thick gray beard

definitions: person who carries or transports something important
person legally entitled to possess a document or instrument
examples: The flag bearer led the parade down Main Street
The coffin bearers moved slowly toward the cemetery
The bearer of this check can cash it at any bank
The passport bearer must present valid identification

definitions: mechanical device that reduces friction between moving parts
person's way of standing, moving, or behaving
direction or position relative to a fixed point
examples: The wheel bearing needs to be replaced immediately
The motor runs smoothly thanks to new ball bearings
She carried herself with the bearing of a queen
His military bearing was evident in his straight posture
The ship's bearing was due north according to the compass
We lost our bearings in the dense fog

definitions: tall black fur hat worn by guards at British royal residences
skin and fur of a bear used as covering or decoration
examples: The palace guard stood motionless in his red coat and bearskin
The bearskin hat is part of the traditional ceremonial uniform
The hunter displayed an old bearskin rug in his cabin
Native Americans traditionally used bearskin for warmth

definitions: handheld kitchen tool with rotating blades for mixing ingredients
person who drives game toward hunters or strikes something repeatedly
examples: She used an electric beater to whip the cream
The old egg beater still works better than the new one
The beater walked through the brush to flush out birds
The carpet beater removed dust from the old rug

definitions: act of hitting someone repeatedly as punishment or attack
overwhelming defeat in competition or conflict
examples: The witness reported seeing a beating in the alley
The boy received a beating for breaking the window
The home team took a beating in yesterday's game
Their proposal took a beating in the committee meeting

definitions: member of 1950s-60s youth movement rejecting conventional society through art and lifestyle
examples: The beatnik read poetry at the underground coffee shop
Jack Kerouac became an icon for beatniks across America

definitions: boyfriend or male admirer in a romantic relationship
examples: She introduced her new beau at the family dinner
Her beau sent flowers every week without fail

definitions: process of making something more attractive or beautiful through enhancement
examples: The city's beautification project included planting trees downtown
The beautification of the park took several months to complete

definitions: large rodent with flat tail that builds dams in rivers
fur from beaver used historically for making felt hats
examples: The beaver built an impressive dam across the stream
We spotted a beaver swimming near its lodge
The gentleman wore an expensive beaver hat to the opera
Beaver fur was highly prized in the 1800s

definitions: complex improvisational jazz style developed in 1940s with fast tempo
examples: Charlie Parker revolutionized jazz with his bebop compositions
The musicians played bebop at the late-night jazz club

definitions: private room used for sleeping, especially in large or formal houses
examples: The queen retired to her bedchamber after the banquet
The old mansion had several ornate bedchambers upstairs

definitions: sheets, blankets, pillows and other materials used on beds
examples: She changed the bedding every week without fail
The hotel provided fresh bedding for each guest

definitions: scene of uproar and confusion with noise and disorder
examples: The classroom turned into complete bedlam when the teacher left
It was absolute bedlam at the store during the sale

definitions: solid rock beneath surface deposits of soil and gravel
fundamental principles or facts serving as foundation for something
examples: The builders had to drill through clay to reach bedrock
The geological survey showed bedrock just ten feet down
Trust forms the bedrock of any successful relationship
These values are the bedrock of our democracy

definitions: space immediately next to or beside a bed
examples: She kept a glass of water on her bedside table
The doctor sat at the patient's bedside all night

definitions: usual or appropriate time for going to bed
examples: The children's bedtime is eight o'clock sharp
She always reads a book before bedtime

definitions: large tree with smooth gray bark and small edible nuts
examples: The old beech tree provided shade for the entire yard
Beech wood is excellent for making furniture

definitions: wood from beech trees used in furniture and flooring
examples: The dining table was crafted from solid beechwood
Beechwood floors give the room a warm appearance

definitions: attractive man with large muscles displayed for admiration
examples: The magazine featured beefcake photos of bodybuilders
He worked out constantly to achieve that beefcake look

definitions: structure where bees live and produce honey
tall rounded women's hairstyle popular in the 1960s
examples: The beekeeper carefully inspected each beehive for disease
Wild bees built a beehive in the old oak tree
Her beehive hairdo required an entire can of hairspray
The beehive hairstyle was fashionable in the sixties

definitions: person who maintains bee colonies for honey production
examples: The beekeeper wore protective gear while collecting honey
Local beekeepers supply honey to the farmers market

definitions: practice of maintaining bee colonies for honey and pollination
examples: She took a course in beekeeping at the agricultural college
Beekeeping has become more popular in urban areas

definitions: short high-pitched sound made by electronic devices
examples: The smoke detector emitted a loud beep every minute
The microwave gave three beeps when the food was ready

definitions: native or inhabitant of Brittany region in France
Celtic language spoken in Brittany, France
examples: The Breton fisherman sold fresh oysters at the market
Many Bretons maintain their traditional cultural practices
She studied Breton to connect with her ancestral heritage
Road signs in Brittany often appear in both French and Breton

definitions: soft creamy French cheese with edible white rind
examples: She served brie with crackers at the wine tasting
The brie should be at room temperature before serving

definitions: informal term for person from Britain or United Kingdom
examples: The Brit explained cricket rules to his American friends
Many Brits vacation in Spain during the summer months

definitions: square piece of rich chocolate cake often containing nuts
member of youngest division of Girl Scouts organization
examples: She baked a batch of fudge brownies for the bake sale
The brownies were still warm from the oven
The Brownie troop went camping for the first time
She earned her cooking badge as a Brownie

definitions: tree producing shiny brown nuts resembling deer eyes
nickname for person from Ohio state
examples: The buckeye tree dropped its nuts all over the lawn
Children collected buckeyes to make crafts
The Buckeye proudly displayed his Ohio State flag
Every Buckeye knows the state tree by heart

definitions: major world religion based on teachings of Buddha emphasizing enlightenment through meditation
examples: Buddhism spread from India throughout Asia over centuries
She studied Buddhism to learn about meditation practices

definitions: person who follows teachings and practices of Buddhism
examples: The Buddhist monk meditated in the temple garden
Many Buddhists gather at the monastery for celebrations

definitions: large wild ox with massive head and shoulders covered in shaggy hair
examples: A herd of buffalo grazed on the open prairie
The buffalo nearly went extinct in the 1800s

definitions: red wine from Burgundy region of France
deep reddish-purple color resembling the wine
examples: He ordered an expensive burgundy to pair with the steak
The sommelier recommended a fine burgundy from 2015
She wore a burgundy dress to the formal dinner
The curtains were a rich burgundy that matched the sofa

definitions: prickly seed covering that clings to fur or clothing
rough edge left on metal after cutting or drilling
rough pronunciation of R sound in some accents
examples: The dog's fur was covered with burrs after the hike
She carefully removed burrs from her wool sweater
The machinist filed away the burr from the metal edge
Sharp burrs on the pipe could cause injury
His Scottish burr made his speech distinctive and charming
The actor perfected his Irish burr for the role

definitions: traditional Japanese warrior code emphasizing loyalty, honor, and martial arts mastery
examples: The samurai lived strictly according to bushido principles
Bushido influenced Japanese culture for many centuries

definitions: member of indigenous hunting and gathering peoples of southern Africa
examples: The Bushman demonstrated traditional hunting techniques to visitors
Bushman rock art dates back thousands of years

definitions: chief male servant in wealthy household responsible for other staff
examples: The butler announced each guest as they arrived
Jeeves was the most famous fictional butler in literature

definitions: isolated flat-topped hill with steep sides found in western landscapes
examples: The lone butte rose dramatically from the desert floor
Native Americans considered the butte a sacred landmark

definitions: person from Byzantine Empire centered in Constantinople
relating to ornate architectural and artistic style of Byzantine Empire
examples: The Byzantine merchant traded silk along ancient routes
Byzantine scholars preserved many classical Greek texts
The church features beautiful Byzantine mosaics and domes
Byzantine architecture influenced buildings throughout the Mediterranean

definitions: man who behaves dishonorably especially toward women
computer-aided design software for technical drawings
examples: That cad broke her heart and never apologized
He proved himself a cad by dating two women simultaneously
The architect used CAD to create building blueprints
Modern CAD programs can generate 3D models easily

definitions: complete blood count medical test measuring blood components
Canadian Broadcasting Corporation national public broadcaster
examples: The doctor ordered a CBC to check for infection
The CBC results showed her white cell count was normal
CBC News reported on the election results last night
She worked as a journalist for the CBC

definitions: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, US federal health agency monitoring public health
examples: The CDC issued new guidelines for preventing flu transmission
CDC researchers tracked the spread of the virus nationwide
